intro: Scabiosa columbaria subsp. banatica, commonly known as the Balkan scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its beauty and nectar-rich flowers.
